title: New laws to protect Parliament from protestors demanded by MPs and peers
text:
New laws to protect Parliament from protestors have been demanded by a joint committee of MPs and peers because of the “normalisation of abuse” of politicians.

The committee on human rights says there should be a new statutory duty on police to “protect the UK’s democratic institutions” and guarantee MPs and lords a right of access after cases of protestors blocking or threatening them.

It also calls for law changes that could see tougher restrictions placed on demonstrations outside Parliament and “enhanced” security including possible pedestrianisation of Parliament Square to make it easier to police.

Police forces should also be required to specifically record crimes against MPs, councillors...
